p: Cubebarum, known as tailed pepper, is mainly grown for its fruits and essential oil [ 115]. Many papers studied its chemical composition. Methyleugenol, eugenol, sabinene, eucalyptol, 4-terpineol, β-pinene, camphor, elemene, α-copaene, β-caryophyllene, epi-cubebol, cubebol and δ-3-carene were reported as the main constituents isolated from the essential oils of the fruits of P. cubeba [ 115, 116, 117, 118]). Eugenol, camphor and methyl eugenol were shown to be activators of TRPA1 [ 61, 62, 63, 107, 110], while the two latter compounds were found to activate TRPV1 [ 64, 65, 106].
